verses.kjv: In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came unto him, and said unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Set thine house in order: for thou shalt die, and not live.
verses.web: In those days Hezekiah was sick and near death. Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, came to him, and said to him, “LORD says, ‘Set your house in order, for you will die, and not live.’ ”
verses.ct: During that time, Hezekiah became deathly ill. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz came to him and said, "This is what the LORD says: 'Get your affairs in order, because you are going to die. You won't recover from this.'"

verses.kjv: Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed unto the LORD,
verses.web: Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to LORD,
verses.ct: Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And said, Remember now, O LORD, I beseech thee, how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.
verses.web: and said, “Remember now, LORD, I beg you, how I have walked before you in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in your sight.” Then Hezekiah wept bitterly.
verses.ct: He said, "Please remember, LORD, how I have lived faithfully before you with a wholehearted devotion, and how I have done what is good in your eyes." Then Hezekiah broke down and wept bitterly.

verses.kjv: Then came the word of the LORD to Isaiah, saying,
verses.web: Then LORD’s word came to Isaiah, saying,
verses.ct: Then the word of the LORD came to Isaiah:

verses.kjv: Go, and say to Hezekiah, Thus saith the LORD, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years.
verses.web: “Go, and tell Hezekiah, ‘LORD, the God of David your father, says, “I have heard your prayer. I have seen your tears. Behold, I will add fifteen years to your life.
verses.ct: "Go tell Hezekiah, 'This is what the LORD, the God of your ancestor David, says: I have heard your prayer. I have seen your tears. I am adding 15 years to your life.

verses.kjv: And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria: and I will defend this city.
verses.web: I will deliver you and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria, and I will defend this city.
verses.ct: I will rescue you and this city from the king of Assyria, and I will defend this city.'"

verses.kjv: And this shall be a sign unto thee from the LORD, that the LORD will do this thing that he hath spoken;
verses.web: This shall be the sign to you from LORD, that LORD will do this thing that he has spoken.
verses.ct: "And this will be the sign from the LORD that he will do exactly what he has promised:

verses.kjv: Behold, I will bring again the shadow of the degrees, which is gone down in the sun dial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward. So the sun returned ten degrees, by which degrees it was gone down.
verses.web: Behold, I will cause the shadow on the sundial, which has gone down on the sundial of Ahaz with the sun, to return backward ten steps.” ’ ” So the sun returned ten steps on the sundial on which it had gone down.
verses.ct: I will make the shadow on the sundial of Ahaz go backward 10 steps." And the sun's shadow moved back 10 steps on the sundial where it had already gone down.

verses.kjv: The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick, and was recovered of his sickness:
verses.web: The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick, and had recovered of his sickness.
verses.ct: This is what King Hezekiah of Judah wrote after he had been sick and recovered from his illness:

verses.kjv: I said in the cutting off of my days, I shall go to the gates of the grave: I am deprived of the residue of my years.
verses.web: I said, “In the middle of my life I go into the gates of Sheol. I am deprived of the residue of my years.”
verses.ct: "I thought, 'In the prime of my life I'm being sent to the gates of death. I've been robbed of the rest of my years.'

verses.kjv: I said, I shall not see the LORD, even the LORD, in the land of the living: I shall behold man no more with the inhabitants of the world.
verses.web: I said, “I won’t see Yah, Yah in the land of the living. I will see man no more with the inhabitants of the world.
verses.ct: I said, 'I will never again see the LORD — the LORD — in the land of the living. I will never again look on another human being among those who dwell in this world.

verses.kjv: Mine age is departed, and is removed from me as a shepherd’s tent: I have cut off like a weaver my life: he will cut me off with pining sickness: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.
verses.web: My dwelling is removed, and is carried away from me like a shepherd’s tent. I have rolled up my life like a weaver. He will cut me off from the loom. From day even to night you will make an end of me.
verses.ct: My life has been pulled away from me, carried off like a shepherd's tent. I've rolled up my life like a weaver rolls up cloth. He is cutting me off from the loom. Between dawn and nightfall, you are bringing me to my end.

verses.kjv: I reckoned till morning, that, as a lion, so will he break all my bones: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.
verses.web: I waited patiently until morning. He breaks all my bones like a lion. From day even to night you will make an end of me.
verses.ct: I waited through the night until morning, but like a lion, he was crushing all my bones. Between dawn and nightfall, you are bringing me to my end.

verses.kjv: Like a crane or a swallow, so did I chatter: I did mourn as a dove: mine eyes fail with looking upward: O LORD, I am oppressed; undertake for me.
verses.web: I chattered like a swallow or a crane. I moaned like a dove. My eyes weaken looking upward. Lord, I am oppressed. Be my security.”
verses.ct: I chirped like a swallow or a crane. I moaned like a dove. My eyes grew weak from looking upward. LORD, I am crushed — come to my defense!'

verses.kjv: What shall I say? he hath both spoken unto me, and himself hath done it: I shall go softly all my years in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.web: What will I say? He has both spoken to me, and himself has done it. I will walk carefully all my years because of the anguish of my soul.
verses.ct: What can I even say? He spoke to me, and he himself has done it. I will walk humbly through all my remaining years because of the anguish my soul has known.

verses.kjv: O LORD, by these things men live, and in all these things is the life of my spirit: so wilt thou recover me, and make me to live.
verses.web: Lord, men live by these things; and my spirit finds life in all of them: you restore me, and cause me to live.
verses.ct: Lord, people find life through these things you do, and my spirit finds its life in all of them. You have restored me and let me live.

verses.kjv: Behold, for peace I had great bitterness: but thou hast in love to my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption: for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back.
verses.web: Behold, for peace I had great anguish, but you have in love for my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption; for you have cast all my sins behind your back.
verses.ct: It's true — instead of peace, I suffered terrible anguish. But in your love you pulled my soul back from the pit of destruction, because you threw all my sins behind your back.

verses.kjv: For the grave cannot praise thee, death can not celebrate thee: they that go down into the pit cannot hope for thy truth.
verses.web: For Sheol can’t praise you. Death can’t celebrate you. Those who go down into the pit can’t hope for your truth.
verses.ct: The grave cannot praise you. Death cannot celebrate you. Those who go down into the pit cannot hope for your faithfulness.

verses.kjv: The living, the living, he shall praise thee, as I do this day: the father to the children shall make known thy truth.
verses.web: The living, the living, he shall praise you, as I do today. The father shall make known your truth to the children.
verses.ct: The living — only the living — can praise you, as I am doing today. Fathers will tell their children about your faithfulness.

verses.kjv: The LORD was ready to save me: therefore we will sing my songs to the stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of the LORD.
verses.web: LORD will save me. Therefore we will sing my songs with stringed instruments all the days of our life in LORD’s house.
verses.ct: The LORD is ready to save me! So we will sing songs with stringed instruments every day of our lives in the house of the LORD."

verses.kjv: For Isaiah had said, Let them take a lump of figs, and lay it for a plaister upon the boil, and he shall recover.
verses.web: Now Isaiah had said, “Let them take a cake of figs, and lay it for a poultice on the boil, and he shall recover.”
verses.ct: Now Isaiah had instructed them, "Take a cake of pressed figs and apply it as a poultice to the boil, and he will recover."

verses.kjv: Hezekiah also had said, What is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the LORD?
verses.web: Hezekiah also had said, “What is the sign that I will go up to LORD’s house?”
verses.ct: Hezekiah had also asked, "What is the sign that I will go up to the house of the LORD?"
